abstract: Plug and play — a popular concept that allows buyers of computers and electronic games to avoid frustrating assembly — is proving hard to pull off for Boeing.
snippet: Plug and play — a popular concept that allows buyers of computers and electronic games to avoid frustrating assembly — is proving hard to pull off for Boeing.
lead_paragraph: CHICAGO  Plug and play  a concept that allows buyers of computers and electronic games to avoid frustrating assembly  is proving difficult for Boeing, which staked its 787 Dreamliner on a far-flung network of suppliers that would send what amounts to snap-on components to a plant for final assembly.

headline.main: Parts Didn’t Click Together for Boeing Jet
headline.print_headline: Snap-on Parts Didn’t Click Together for Boeing Jet

byline.original: By Jeff Bailey and Nicola Clark
